shellcommand_test.comment: Ensure 'httpd -M | grep log_config' output Pattern Match '^log_config_module (static)$' (string)
Ensure 'apache2 -M | grep log_config' output Pattern Match '^log_config_module (static)$' (string)
Ensure 'httpd -M | grep ' dav_[[:print:]]+module'' output Pattern Not Match '^mod_dav.* \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'apache2 -M | grep ' dav_[[:print:]]+module'' output Pattern Not Match '^mod_dav.* \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'httpd -M | egrep 'status_module'' output Pattern Not Match '^mod_status \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'apache2 -M | egrep 'status_module'' output Pattern Not Match '^mod_status \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'httpd -M | grep autoindex_module' output Pattern Not Match '^autoindex_module \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'apache2-M | grep autoindex_module' output Pattern Not Match '^autoindex_module \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'httpd -M | grep proxy_' output Pattern Not Match '^mod_proxy \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'apache2 -M | grep proxy_' output Pattern Not Match '^mod_proxy \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'httpd -M | grep userdir_' output Pattern Not Match '^mod_userdir \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'apache2 -M | grep userdir_' output Pattern Not Match '^mod_userdir \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'httpd -M | egrep 'info_module'' output Pattern Not Match '^mod_info \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'apache2 -M | egrep 'info_module'' output Pattern Not Match '^mod_info \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'httpd -M | grep auth_basic_module' output Pattern Not Match '^mod_auth_basic \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'httpd -M | grep auth_digest_module' output Pattern Not Match '^mod_auth_digest \(s.+\)$' (string)
Ensure 'passwd -S apache' output Pattern Match '^apache.*(Password locked|L)$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory *\//i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*Require all denied$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory *\//i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/apache2/apache2.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*Require all denied$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory *\//i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*AllowOverride None$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory *\//i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/apache2/apache2.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*AllowOverride None$' (string)
Ensure 'grep -i AllowOverride /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*AllowOverride None$' (string)
Ensure 'grep -i AllowOverride /etc/apache2/apache2.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*AllowOverride None$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory */i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*Options None$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory */i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/apache2/apache2.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*Options None$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory */i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf' output Pattern Match '^Options.*(None|Multiviews)$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory */i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/apache2/apache2.conf' output Pattern Match '^Options.*(None|Multiviews)$' (boolean)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory */i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf' output Pattern Not Match '^Options.*Includes$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory */i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/apache2/apache2.conf' output Pattern Not Match '^Options.*Includes$' (string)
Ensure 'httpd -M | grep security2_module' output Pattern Match '^security2_module$' (string)
Ensure 'apache2 -M | grep security2_module' output Pattern Match '^security2_module$' (string)
Ensure 'httpd -M | egrep 'ssl_module|nss_module'' output Pattern Match '^mod_(ssl|nss)$' (string)
Ensure 'apache2 -M | egrep 'ssl_module|nss_module'' output Pattern Match '^mod_(ssl|nss)$' (string)
Ensure 'aa-status --enabled && echo Enabled' output Pattern Match '^Enabled$' (string)

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure at least one file named /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf exists and matches pattern ^User.*apache$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf exists and matches pattern ^Group.*apache$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/apache2/apache2.conf exists and matches pattern ^User.*apache$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/apache2/apache2.conf exists and matches pattern ^Group.*apache$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/passwd exists and matches pattern ^apache.*(\/sbin\/nologin|\/dev\/null)$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf exists and matches pattern ^ServerTokens.*(Prod|uctOnly)$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/apache2/apache2.conf exists and matches pattern ^ServerTokens.*(Prod|uctOnly)$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf exists and matches pattern ^ServerSignature.*Off$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/apache2/apache2.conf exists and matches pattern ^ServerSignature.*Off$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf exists and matches pattern ^Timeout.*([0-9]|10)$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/apache2/apache2.conf exists and matches pattern ^Timeout.*([0-9]|10)$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf exists and matches pattern ^KeepAlive.*On$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/apache2/apache2.conf exists and matches pattern ^KeepAlive.*On$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf exists and matches pattern ^KeepAliveTimeout.*([0-9]|1[0-5])$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/apache2/apache2.conf exists and matches pattern ^KeepAliveTimeout.*([0-9]|1[0-5])$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf exists and matches pattern ^LimitRequestLine.*([0-9]|[1-8][0-9]|9[0-9]|[1-4][0-9]{2}|50[0-9]|51[0-2])$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/apache2/apache2.conf exists and matches pattern ^LimitRequestLine.*([0-9]|[1-8][0-9]|9[0-9]|[1-4][0-9]{2}|50[0-9]|51[0-2])$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf exists and matches pattern ^LimitRequestFields.*([0-9]|[1-8][0-9]|9[0-9]|100)$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/apache2/apache2.conf exists and matches pattern ^LimitRequestFields.*([0-9]|[1-8][0-9]|9[0-9]|100)$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf exists and matches pattern ^LimitRequestFieldsize.*([0-9]|[1-8][0-9]|9[0-9]|100)$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/apache2/apache2.conf exists and matches pattern ^LimitRequestFieldsize.*([0-9]|[1-8][0-9]|9[0-9]|100)$

file_test.comment: Ensure at least one file(s) named httpd in /etc exists and is owned by user 0
Ensure at least one file(s) named apache2 in /etc exists and is owned by user 0
Ensure at least one file(s) named httpd in /etc exists and is owned by group 0
Ensure at least one file(s) named apache2 in /etc exists and is owned by group 0

sestatus_test.comment: No TitleEnsure SELinux Is Enabled in Enforcing Mode

apparmorstatus_test.comment: Ensure Apache AppArmor Profile is in Enforce Mode

Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory *\//i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/apache2/apache2.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*AllowOverride None$' (string)
Ensure 'grep -i AllowOverride /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*AllowOverride None$' (string)
Ensure 'grep -i AllowOverride /etc/apache2/apache2.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*AllowOverride None$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory */i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*Options None$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory */i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/apache2/apache2.conf' output Pattern Match '^.*Options None$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory */i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf' output Pattern Match '^Options.*(None|Multiviews)$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory */i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/apache2/apache2.conf' output Pattern Match '^Options.*(None|Multiviews)$' (boolean)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory */i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf' output Pattern Not Match '^Options.*Includes$' (string)
Ensure 'perl -ne 'print if /^ *<Directory */i .. /<\/Directory/i' /etc/apache2/apache2.conf' output Pattern Not Match '^Options.*Includes$' (string)
Ensure 'httpd -M | grep security2_module' output Pattern Match '^security2_module$' (string)
Ensure 'apache2 -M | grep security2_module' output Pattern Match '^security2_module$' (string)
Ensure 'httpd -M | egrep 'ssl_module|nss_module'' output Pattern Match '^mod_(ssl|nss)$' (string)
Ensure 'apache2 -M | egrep 'ssl_module|nss_module'' output Pattern Match '^mod_(ssl|nss)$' (string)
Ensure 'aa-status --enabled && echo Enabled' output Pattern Match '^Enabled$' (string)

file_state.comment: Ensure at least one file(s) named httpd in /etc exists and is owned by user 0
Ensure at least one file(s) named apache2 in /etc exists and is owned by user 0
Ensure at least one file(s) named httpd in /etc exists and is owned by group 0
Ensure at least one file(s) named apache2 in /etc exists and is owned by group 0

sestatus_state.comment: No TitleEnsure SELinux Is Enabled in Enforcing Mode

apparmorstatus_state.comment: Ensure Apache AppArmor Profile is in Enforce Mode

This value is used in Rule: Ensure the Log Config Module Is Enabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the WebDAV Modules Are Disabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the WebDAV Modules Are Disabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the Status Module Is Disabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the Status Module Is Disabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the Autoindex Module Is Disabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the Autoindex Module Is Disabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the Proxy Modules Are Disabled if not in use
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the Proxy Modules Are Disabled if not in use
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the User Directories Module Is Disabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the User Directories Module Is Disabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the Info Module Is Disabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the Info Module Is Disabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the Basic and Digest Authentication Modules are Disabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the Basic and Digest Authentication Modules are Disabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure the Apache User Account Is Locked
This value is used in Rule: Ensure Access to OS Root Directory Is Denied By Default
This value is used in Rule: Ensure Access to OS Root Directory Is Denied By Default
This value is used in Rule: Ensure OverRide Is Disabled for the OS Root Directory
This value is used in Rule: Ensure OverRide Is Disabled for the OS Root Directory
This value is used in Rule: Ensure OverRide Is Disabled for All Directories
This value is used in Rule: Ensure OverRide Is Disabled for All Directories
This value is used in Rule: Ensure Options for the OS Root Directory Are Restricted
This value is used in Rule: Ensure Options for the OS Root Directory Are Restricted
This value is used in Rule: Ensure Options for the Web Root Directory Are Restricted
This value is used in Rule: Ensure Options for the Web Root Directory Are Restricted
This value is used in Rule: Ensure Options for Other Directories Are Minimized
This value is used in Rule: Ensure Options for Other Directories Are Minimized
This value is used in Rule: Ensure ModSecurity Is Installed and Enabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure ModSecurity Is Installed and Enabled
This value is used in Rule: Ensure mod_ssl and/or mod_nss Is Installed
This value is used in Rule: Ensure mod_ssl and/or mod_nss Is Installed
